learning_objectives.description: Describe how paper chromatography is used to separate mixtures of soluble substances, using a suitable solvent
Describe the use of locating agents when separating mixtures containing colourless substances. Knowledge of specific locating agents is not required
Interpret simple chromatograms to identify: (a) unknown substances by comparison with known substances (b) pure and impure substances
State and use the equation for R₟: R₟ = distance travelled by substance / distance travelled by solvent
